hook.text: Couples who talk openly about sex report 40% higher satisfaction, yet most couples rarely discuss it.

buildup.text: Cultural taboos, shame, and fear of rejection make sexual communication feel risky and uncomfortable.

discovery.text: Effective sexual communication uses specific language, positive framing, and happens outside of sexual situations.

twist.text: Assuming your partner knows what you want is the most common communication error couples make about sex.

climax.text: Learning to discuss desires, boundaries, and concerns openly transforms both sexual and emotional intimacy.

punchline.text: If you can do it, you can talk about it. Start talking.

quiz.question: How much higher satisfaction do couples who discuss sex openly report?
